examples: The feeling of sickness soon passed.
The drug produces a feeling of excitement.
He had mixed feelings about the whole project.
Have you considered my feelings?
Have you considered my feelings?
words.defineEn: something that one feels such as happiness, guilt, sadness, etc.
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mà một người cảm thấy như hạnh phúc, tội lỗi, buồn bã, vv

examples: People will also simply get bored.
I was bored.
I was bored.
- I'm bored.
I'm bored.
words.defineEn: tired and unhappy because there is nothing to do or because we are no longer interested in something
words.defineVi: mệt mỏi và không vui vì không có gì để làm hoặc vì chúng ta không còn hứng thú với điều gì đó

examples: I'm excited about the next episode of my favorite TV show.
The children were excited to try the unusual-looking dragon fruit, an exotic accessory fruit.
The children were excited to learn about colors in art class.
We are excited to travel to our friend's wedding in another state.
She was excited to buy new clothes for the summer season.
words.defineEn: feeling very happy, interested, and energetic
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất hạnh phúc, thích thú và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: I'm tired of your playing fast and loose with me.
People will get tired of listening to him!
We're tired of hearing it!
I'm tired of working in this thankless IT support job.
I got tired of starting from square one again, man.
words.defineEn: needing to sleep or rest because of not having any more energy
words.defineVi: cần ngủ hoặc nghỉ ngơi vì không còn năng lượng

examples: Taylor was bitterly disappointed to be dropped from the England side.
I'm disappointed about their decision, but I'm not losing any sleep over it.
I'm disappointed that I didn't get the job but that's the way the cookie crumbles.
We were left feeling rather disappointed.
I know you're disappointed, but you need to roll up your sleeves and redouble your efforts.
words.defineEn: not satisfied with something, especially because one expected otherwise
words.defineVi: không hài lòng với một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là bởi vì một mong đợi khác

examples: Police are worried that many crimes go unreported.
I'm not worried about my finances.
She was worried she was stuck in a dead-end job.
I'm worried that I didn't give a good account of myself in that job interview today.
I’m not worried about stepping on anybody’s toes.
words.defineEn: feeling unhappy and afraid because of something that has happened or might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy không vui và sợ hãi vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc có thể xảy ra

examples: I know you're annoyed to have gotten another parking ticket, but that's life.
I was, to put it mildly, annoyed.
Mom already seemed annoyed, but the fat really hit the fire when she found out that you'd been lying to her.
I'm annoyed.
It's actually spelled annoyed grunt.
words.defineEn: being angry to some extent
words.defineVi: tức giận ở một mức độ nào đó

examples: Holy moly, this is exciting news!
The company CEO let the employees in on the exciting news about the upcoming merger.
Hockey is an exciting sport played on ice or field, with sticks and a small puck or ball.
Take the initiative and fill your life with exciting experiences.
They claim drag racing is the most exciting motor sport.
words.defineEn: making us feel interested, happy, and energetic
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy thích thú, hạnh phúc và tràn đầy năng lượng

examples: It was a long and tiring day, but as the waiter brought me my dinner, I thought to myself, "Well, this is more like it."
It's tiring.
And if you're having a really tiring day.
But it gets so tiring, it gets so exhausting.
There were months where I was on the road three out of four weeks, and it was tiring.
words.defineEn: (particularly of an acivity) causing a feeling of physical or mental fatigue or exhaustion
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt là một hoạt động) gây ra cảm giác mệt mỏi hoặc kiệt sức về thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: Interrupting others is annoying, so try to break the habit.
Interrupting others is annoying, so try to break the habit.
However, too much of a good thing can get annoying.
We finally got rid of your younger brother, he's so annoying!
Lines are super annoying.
words.defineEn: causing slight anger
words.defineVi: gây ra sự tức giận nhẹ

examples: Then, in November 2015, health officials in Brazil raised alarm about a worrying trend.
That's worrying, because that would indicate to me that he's not just a middle-aged man that's just stupidly fallen in love with a young girl.
Champagne became the world's first wine-growing region to examine its carbon footprint and implement a carbon plan, as a result of worrying statistics.
It's a disturbing trend, for sure, and worrying, worrying conditions on the ground.

The presence or absence of the ruler during major media spectacles may also be a worrying sign, like in 2008 when Kim Jong-un's father and then leader was due at a major military parade to celebrate the country's founding.
words.defineEn: causing someone to feel anxious or concerned about something, often due to the possibility of an uncertain or negative outcome
words.defineVi: khiến ai đó cảm thấy lo lắng hoặc lo lắng về điều gì đó, thường là do khả năng xảy ra kết quả không chắc chắn hoặc tiêu cực

examples: It's true that reality is disappointing.
She used the wrong ingredients in the recipe, resulting in a disappointing dish.
But then the wheels came off the bus in the final season, and now it's often derided as one of the most disappointing finales of all time.
After receiving the disappointing news, John's face turned dark and he had a face like thunder for the rest of the day.
And the speakers are pretty disappointing as well.
words.defineEn: not fulfilling expectations
words.defineVi: không đáp ứng mong đợi

examples: The movie was as boring as they come.
It’s so boring, eating the same food day in, day out.
I have to do the same boring jobs day in day out.
The child nodded off to sleep during the boring lecture.
This course seemed right up my alley when I signed up for it, but it ended up being dreadfully boring.
words.defineEn: making us feel tired and unsatisfied because of not being interesting
words.defineVi: khiến chúng ta cảm thấy mệt mỏi và không hài lòng vì không thú vị

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: That holiday cost me a small fortune.
The closing of the airport knocked our holiday plans on the head.
I'll always remember this holiday.
My favorite month is December because of the holidays.
We sometimes visit our relatives during the holidays.
words.defineEn: a period of recreation away from home or work
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian giải trí xa nhà hoặc nơi làm việc

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Short hair really becomes you.
The child will become an adult.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
The old government program has become a sacred cow.
words.defineEn: to start or grow to be
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc phát triển để được

examples: He married a millionaire, and since then he's been living the life of Riley!
The successful entrepreneur knew that money makes money and used his initial profits to fund new business ventures that eventually made him a millionaire.
Even though the millionaire had a reputation for being difficult and unpleasant, he always had people around him, eager to curry favor and enjoy the benefits of his wealth.
Millionaires, billionaires.
Abby: After Vanderbilt's death, the island passed hands between millionaires.
words.defineEn: a person whose wealth amounts to or exceeds one million units of currency
words.defineVi: một người có số tiền lên tới hoặc vượt quá một triệu đơn vị tiền tệ

examples: The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
A vase on a side table caught his eye.
The new law caught them unawares.
He caught a glimpse of his reflection in the glass.
As she turned back, a movement across the lawn caught her eye.
words.defineEn: to capture or grab something or someone using methods like hunting, chasing, or trapping
words.defineVi: để chụp hoặc lấy một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó bằng cách sử dụng các phương pháp như săn bắn, đuổi theo hoặc bẫy

examples: The chef used fish paste as a filling for his sushi rolls
This fish is as dead as a herring.
I soon had the fish in a net.
The big fellow keeps a fish shop near the post office.
The colorful fish in the aquarium captured my attention.
words.defineEn: an animal with a tail, gills and fins that lives in water
words.defineVi: một con vật có đuôi, mang và vây sống dưới nước

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to eat or drink something
words.defineVi: để ăn hoặc uống một cái gì đó

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
The chef prepared a creamy tomato soup for lunch.
The employee took a lunch break in the cafeteria.
I made a delicious turkey and cheese sandwich for lunch.
I ate a sandwich and a half for lunch.
words.defineEn: a meal eaten in the middle of the day
words.defineVi: một bữa ăn vào giữa ngày

words.defineEn: to rest or sleep for a short period of time during the day
words.defineVi: để nghỉ ngơi hoặc ngủ trong một khoảng thời gian ngắn trong ngày

examples: And that's what you call a siesta.
words.defineEn: a short period of rest or sleep, typically taken during the afternoon
words.defineVi: một thời gian nghỉ ngơi hoặc ngủ ngắn, thường được thực hiện vào buổi chiều

examples: He earned his money by the sweat of his brow.
He certainly earned his place in the sun.
She earns money sitting for artists.
Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
Owing to legal changes, young barristers can no longer earn easy money on undefended divorces, which are now done by solicitors.
words.defineEn: to get money for the job that we do or services that we provide
words.defineVi: để có được tiền cho công việc mà chúng tôi làm hoặc dịch vụ mà chúng tôi cung cấp

examples: The business is losing money.
Money can't buy happiness.
Money means nothing to him.
A lot of people give money to good causes.
My parents give me pocket money every week.
words.defineEn: something that people use to buy and sell goods and services, can be in the form of coins or paper bills
words.defineVi: thứ mà mọi người sử dụng để mua và bán hàng hóa và dịch vụ, có thể ở dạng tiền xu hoặc hóa đơn giấy

examples: All newspapers sang from the same song sheet.
We sang songs to pass the time.
She can't sing for toffee.
Every night she sings the baby to sleep.
Cheerleaders from both schools sang the National Anthem before the start of the game and there were chills down my spine.
words.defineEn: to use our voice in order to produce musical sounds in the form of a tune or song
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của chúng tôi để tạo ra âm thanh âm nhạc dưới dạng một giai điệu hoặc bài hát

examples: Alice's song hits the airwaves.
That song always sends a shiver down my spine.
Fans have given the band's new song their seal of approval.
That band's new song is really off the hook!
She bought the painting for a song.
words.defineEn: a piece of music that has words
words.defineVi: một bản nhạc có lời

examples: What time does the show start?
Start the engines!
The school semester starts next month.
Who started the fire?
The trail starts just outside the town.
words.defineEn: to begin doing or using something that we were not doing or using before, and continue doing or using it
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu làm hoặc sử dụng một cái gì đó mà chúng tôi đã không làm hoặc sử dụng trước đó và tiếp tục làm hoặc sử dụng nó

examples: Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
The business is losing money.
The business has legs.
Many businesses use the Salesforce platform for customer relationship management.
words.defineEn: the activity of providing services or products in exchange for money
words.defineVi: hoạt động cung cấp dịch vụ hoặc sản phẩm để đổi lấy tiền

examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: Soon, with the return of the peasants and fishermen, the village comes to life again.
The road continues through the village of Knightwick.
Three villages have gone without water for days.
The village was set among olive groves on a hill.
The place still feels like a small fishing village.
words.defineEn: a very small town located in the countryside
words.defineVi: một thị trấn rất nhỏ nằm ở nông thôn
